message.content:
cs.CR, cs.OS, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SY

The paper discusses a security challenge related to timing channels in cloud environments and proposes a hypervisor-enforced timing mitigation approach. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Security (cs.CR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on the implementation of the proposed approach on existing operating systems such as Linux, which suggests that it may also belong to the Operating Systems (cs.OS) sub-category. The paper also discusses resource sharing and performance costs, which are relevant to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The proposed approach involves enforcing a deterministic view of time on guest code, which is related to Software Engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper proposes a system that can mitigate timing-channel leakage, which is relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
